intro: Lechea mucronata var. sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flowered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically features erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color. Its leaves are usually ovate and have a hairy texture, and the plant is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
